Docs.param: if true, characters that are not part of the GSM alphabet are counted as a single space char. If false, a messageBody containing non-GSM alphabet characters is calculated for 16-bit encoding.
Docs.summary: Calculates the number of SMS's required to encode the message body and the number of characters remaining until the next message, given the current encoding.

remarks.para: Calculates the number of SMS's required to encode the message body and the number of characters remaining until the next message, given the current encoding.

Docs.summary: Returns the record index of the message on the SIM (1-based index).

Docs.summary: Returns true for CPHS MWI toggle message.

remarks.para: Returns true for CPHS MWI toggle message.

Docs.summary: Returns true if message is an email.

remarks.para: Returns true if message is an email.

Docs.summary: returns true if this message is a CPHS voicemail / message waiting indicator (MWI) clear message

remarks.para: returns true if this message is a CPHS voicemail / message waiting indicator (MWI) clear message

Docs.summary: returns true if this message is a "Message Waiting Indication Group: Discard Message" notification and should not be stored.

Docs.summary: returns true if this message is a CPHS voicemail / message waiting indicator (MWI) set message

remarks.para: returns true if this message is a CPHS voicemail / message waiting indicator (MWI) set message

Docs.summary: See TS 23.040 9.2.3.9 returns true if this is a "replace short message" SMS

remarks.para: See TS 23.040 9.2.3.9 returns true if this is a "replace short message" SMS

Docs.summary: Returns true iff the TP-Reply-Path bit is set in this message.

remarks.para: Returns true iff the TP-Reply-Path bit is set in this message.

Docs.summary: Return true iff the message is a SMS-STATUS-REPORT message.

remarks.para: Return true iff the message is a SMS-STATUS-REPORT message.

Docs.summary: The maximum number of payload bytes per message

remarks.para: The maximum number of payload bytes per message

Docs.summary: The maximum number of payload septets per message

remarks.para: The maximum number of payload septets per message

Docs.summary: The maximum number of payload septets per message if a user data header is present.

remarks.para: The maximum number of payload septets per message if a user data header is present. This assumes the header only contains the CONCATENATED_8_BIT_REFERENCE element.

Docs.summary: Returns the message body as a String, if it exists and is text based.

remarks.para: Returns the message body as a String, if it exists and is text based.

Docs.summary: Returns the originating address (sender) of this SMS message in String form or null if unavailable

remarks.para: Returns the originating address (sender) of this SMS message in String form or null if unavailable

Docs.summary: Get protocol identifier.

remarks.para: Get protocol identifier.

Docs.summary: Unofficial convention of a subject line enclosed in parens empty string if not present

remarks.para: Unofficial convention of a subject line enclosed in parens empty string if not present

Docs.summary: Returns the address of the SMS service center that relayed this message or null if there is none.

remarks.para: Returns the address of the SMS service center that relayed this message or null if there is none.

Docs.summary: GSM: For an SMS-STATUS-REPORT message, this returns the status field from the status report.

remarks.para: GSM: For an SMS-STATUS-REPORT message, this returns the status field from the status report. This field indicates the status of a previously submitted SMS, if requested. See TS 23.040, 9.2.3.15 TP-Status for a description of values. CDMA: For not interfering with status codes from GSM, the value is shifted to the bits 31-16. The value is composed of an error class (bits 25-24) and a status code (bits 23-16). Possible codes are described in C.S0015-B, v2.0, 4.5.21.

Docs.summary: Returns the status of the message on the SIM (read, unread, sent, unsent).

remarks.para: Returns the status of the message on the SIM (read, unread, sent, unsent).

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which contains the java.lang.Class JNI value corresponding to this type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control which jclass is provided to methods like .

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which provides the declaring type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control virtual vs. non virtual method dispatch against the underlying JNI object. When this property is equal to the declaring type, then virtual method invocation against the JNI object is performed; otherwise, we assume that the method was overridden by a derived type, and perform non-virtual methdo invocation.

Docs.summary: Returns the service centre timestamp in currentTimeMillis() format

remarks.para: Returns the service centre timestamp in currentTimeMillis() format
